questions.question_text: During the normalization process a discovery model can be fully normalized based on which of these fields? (Choose three.)
Within ServiceNow Discovery, the Identification phase determines what?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is:

A. Have I seen you before?
During the Identification phase in ServiceNow Discovery, the system determines whether the discovered device or CI (Configuration Item) already exists in the Configuration Management Database (CMDB). It compares the discovered attributes against existing records to avoid duplicate entries and ensure accurate asset tracking.

Selected Answer: A
Identification: After classification, the police check their records to see if the suspect has a criminal history. They ask, “Have we seen you before?” ...https://www.servicenow.com/community/itom-articles/servicenow-discovery-4-phase-process-pcie-through-a-simple-crime/ta-p/3091330

choices.C: What else can you tell me about yourself?
choices.B: How should I classify you specifically?
choices.D: Are you there? How will I classify you?

questions.question_text: What is unmanaged spend when viewing the Software Spend Detection Overview dashboard?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is:

A. The total spend for transactions where the publisher and product are identified but there's no software model identified for the product.
Unmanaged spend refers to software expenses where the relevant publisher and product are known, but no corresponding software model has been established within the system. This represents a potential compliance risk and indicates areas where further management and oversight are needed to align spending with organizational policies

Selected Answer: A
Total spend for transactions where the publisher and product are identified but there's no software model for the product... https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/xanadu-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/software-spend-detection-overview-dashboard.html

choices.D: The total spend for transactions that are identified for an unmanaged publisher
choices.B: The total spend for transactions where the publisher, product, and software model are identified but there's no software installations identified for the product
choices.C: The total spend for transactions that are not identified as an accounts payable spend or an expense spend
choices.A: The total spend for transactions where the publisher and product are identified but there's no software model identified for the product

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is:

A. The service must be opted in to and can be opted out of in the future if required
The Software Asset Management (SAM) Content Service requires organizations to opt in to leverage its features, such as receiving updated software recognition rules and normalization content. If necessary, organizations can later opt out to discontinue participation without affecting their core SAM operations.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct. https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/xanadu-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/c_SAMContentService.html

questions.question_text: What is required to manage utilization of the Software Asset Management Content Service?

choices.C: A script must be defied to identify what information should be shared with the Content Service
choices.E: The service must be opted in to but, once enabled, it cannot be opted out of
choices.B: The service is automatically enabled through the baseline installation but can be opted out of if required
choices.D: Nothing. The service is automatically enabled and cannot be opted out of
choices.A: The service must be opted in to and can be opted out of n the future if required
